title: Album Page, "Sketches of Château de Fontainebleau", May 8, 1888
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 30; lower right corner: 28; clockwise from center: Pavillion S...ly / Fontaine bleau / May 8- 1888; Tour de l'Horloge; These are the first sketches made in 1888 after six months at the school where / I did no free hand drawing whatever  - (they are very bad); Pavillion sur cour du cheval.
description: Vertical sheet depicting three sketches of architectural elements of the Château de Fontainebleau.  The upper half of the sheet depicts a tall mansard roof with chimney and a round tower with steep roof and classical dormer to the right.  To the right of this sketch is the letter F, rendered as if made up of masonry segments.  The lower half of the sheet illustrates the clock tower (Tour de l'Horloge) and the pavillon of the Cour de Cheval.  The clock tower is in a very reserved Renaissance style with three stories, each defined by columns at the corners and separated by stringcourses, surmounted by an arcaded cupola and finial.  The pavillion at left is in the French Renaissance style, the two floors dominated by the massive, overscaled mansard roof above.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketches of Château de Fontainebleau", May 8, 1888.Graphite on cream paperboard tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-201.
